summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It covers the period from August 9, 2019, the day before his death, through August 13, 2019, detailing his activities, the discovery of his body, medical response, notifications to authorities, and the subsequent investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead. He had attorney visits the day before.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who departed for court on the morning of August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge was notified of Epstein's death at 10:00 am on August 10, 2019, and later provided with a press release.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein spends the day in attorney conferences and is reported to be in good spirits during a social call in the evening.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm is activated. Staff find Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR is initiated and EMS is called.

events.title: Epstein Pronounced Dead
events.description: At 7:36 am, the ER physician reports the official time of death. His body is later transported to Beekman Hospital and then released to the Medical Examiner.

events.title: Notifications and Investigation Launch
events.description: Multiple agencies are notified including the FBI, AUSA, OIG, and Judge Berman. The FBI and OIG arrive at the institution to investigate.

events.title: Next of Kin Notified
events.description: Epstein's brother is notified of his death by the Case Management Coordinator at 11:00 am.

events.title: Computer Hard Drives Removed
events.description: Late in the evening, the Computer Services Manager arrives to remove and replace hard drives from computers in the SHU.

events.title: OIG Secures Video Footage
events.description: An OIG Agent departs the institution with computers containing video footage from the SHU.

events.title: FBI Investigation Continues
events.description: The FBI returns to the institution multiple times throughout the day and evening.

events.title: Senior Staff Arrive
events.description: Central Office and Regional Office staff arrive at the institution for meetings.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC New York SHU at 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
He was pronounced dead by an ER physician at 7:36 am on August 10, 2019, after being transported to Beekman Hospital.
The timeline shows Epstein was in attorney conferences all day on August 9 and was reported to be in 'good spirits' during a social call at 7:00 pm that evening.
Computer hard drives from the SHU were removed and replaced late on the night of August 10, 2019, and video footage computers were taken by the OIG on August 11.
Multiple agencies (FBI, OIG, AUSA) were notified and began investigating immediately following the discovery of Epstein's body.
